modules package

Submodules

modules.fk_solver module

Module allows forward kinematics to be calculated

class modules.fk_solver.FkSolver(links: dict)

Bases: object

Class allows to calculate forward kinematics of the robotic arm with given parameters and specified length of robotic arm links. Forward kinematics is being calculated using Denavit–Hartenberg notation.

fk_check_input_param()
fk_dh(theta1: float, theta2: float, theta3: float, theta4: float) → Tuple[array, str]

Method creates dh table with the given parameters.

Parameters

  • theta1 – Base rotation angle

  • theta2 – 1st link rotation angle

  • theta3 – 2nd link rotation angle

  • theta4 – 3rd link rotation angle

Returns

dh_table, status

static fk_hom_matrix(dh_table: array, i: int) → array

Generation of homogenous transformation matrices Ti.

Parameters

  • dh_table – Denavit–Hartenbergs table

  • i – Number of transformations

Returns

t_dh - Homogenous trans. matrix Ti

fk_solve_auto(theta1: float, theta2: float, theta3: float, theta4: float) → Tuple[int, List[Tuple[float, float, float]], str]

Calculate end effectors xyz pos. with given rotations of initialized robotic model.

Parameters

  • theta1 – Base rotation angle

  • theta2 – 1st link rotation angle

  • theta3 – 2nd link rotation angle

  • theta4 – 3rd link rotation angle

Returns

alpha; xyz_pos_link; status: Orientation and list of xyz positions of each link end

static fk_solve_user(dh_table) → Tuple[int, List[Tuple[float, float, float]], str]

Calculate end effectors xyz pos. with given dh table.

Parameters

dh_table – Denavit–Hartenbergs table

Returns

alpha; xyz_pos_link; status: Orientation and list of xyz positions of each link end

static fk_solver(dh_table) → Tuple[int, List[Tuple[float, float, float]], str]

Forward kinematics end effector xyz pos. solver.

Parameters

dh_table – Denavit–Hartenbergs table

Returns

alpha; xyz_pos_link; status: Orientation and list of xyz positions of each link end

modules.ik_solver module

Module allows inverse kinematics to be calculated

class modules.ik_solver.IkSolver(links: dict)

Bases: object

Class allows to calculate inverse kinematics of the robotic arm with given parameters and specified length of robotic arm links.

Inverse kinematics is being calculated using geometrical method.

ik_check_input_param()
ik_get_config1()
ik_get_config2()
ik_solver(px: int, py: int, pz: int, alfa: int)
